sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: You're watching Euronews now. I'm Takumbo Silako with your top stories.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: The French president is in Moscow this afternoon to meet his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Emmanuel Macron says the deal is in reach to end the crisis over Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Meanwhile, Germany's Chancellor Olaf Scholz is going to Washington to seek support over the country's stance on arms sales to Kiev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: is going to Washington to seek support over the country's stance on arms sales to Kiev.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: And to the victor, the spoils. Senegal's Tereng Alliance write a new page in the record books with success in the Africa Cup of Nations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: All eyes will be on French President Emmanuel Macron as he meets with Russia's President

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Putin on Monday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: The meeting comes as tensions between Moscow and the West increase.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Macron says his visit will centre on dialogue and de-escalation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: It follows Russian troop build-up at the border of Ukraine with around 130,000 soldiers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Joint military exercises will also begin this week with its ally Belarus.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz will meet US President Joe Biden on Monday, followed by visits to Ukraine and Russia in a separate bid to reach a resolution.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: I'm not going there to have a coffee. It's about making real, tough, important policies. This is a critical situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: real tough important policies this is a critical situation i think we must always be clear about what we are promising but rightly so this is about preventing a war in europe that's the serious matter and that is what i owe to the citizens of our country to whom i also feel responsible with regard to the European peace order and our allies." Scholz emphasized that the European NATO partners and the US would closely coordinate their actions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: He also referred to Germany's engagement with NATO and Ukraine with German troops in Lithuania.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The President of France is the first European leader who is set to meet in person with Vladimir Putin in an attempt to find a diplomatic solution to de-escalate the Ukraine crisis.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: In an interview to the Journal de Dimanche, Emmanuel Macron said that it was important to prevent the situation from worsening. He stressed that the integrity and security of Ukraine, of any other European nation could not be compromised.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But he also said that it was legitimate for Russia to raise the issue of its security concerns.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Vladimir Putin's spokesman said that this visit will be very important and that the talks will that this visit will be very important and that the talks will focus on Russia's security guarantee demands to the US and NATO.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Emmanuel Macron is in close contact with Joe Biden.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: He spoke with him as well as with the Secretary General of NATO on Sunday over the phone.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Some experts believe that Emmanuel Macron will try to figure out if there are any confidence-building measures that could become a bonus to American office in order to de-escalate the situation.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: On Tuesday, Emmanuel Macron will travel to Kyiv and will meet with the President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: But the efforts to stay on the path of the dialogue will continue as the new German Chancellor who is today meeting with Joe Biden in Washington is expected in Moscow on February 15.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: Galina Pavlonskaya for Euronews.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Germany's ambiguous stance on the Ukraine-Russia crisis may be explained by its energy dependence. The country imports more than 40% of the oil and 55% of the gas it consumes from Russia, an amount it hoped to increase significantly thanks to Nord Stream 2. The pipeline of more than 1,200 kilometres runs parallel to Nord Stream 1 and connects Russia and Germany through the Baltic Sea without passing through third countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: At a cost of more than 9 billion euros to build, the Russian state-owned company Gazprom, the main shareholder, has not yet received the legal permits to start operations.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Failure to obtain them would be a financial blow to the Kremlin's coffers.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Although Washington and Brussels have brandished the threat, Berlin is reluctant to paralyse the pipeline to put pressure on Moscow, as this year it plans to abandon nuclear energy and switch to natural gas in its transition to renewable energies.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The German government's stance is also influenced by its past as an aggressor power.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Since the end of World War II, Germany has refused to supply weapons to any party to a conflict, a principle it has violated on occasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: When in January Germany offered to supply 5,000 military helmets to Ukraine to help it defend itself against a possible Russian invasion, it provoked outrage in some quarters, with Ukraine officials describing the offer as a joke. But Germany's defence minister Christine Lembergth said sending arms to Ukraine would not be helpful as tensions are still ongoing.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: According to polls, six out of ten Germans agree with the decision not to send arms to Ukraine.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: However, many consider the Social Democratic Party to be too pro-Russia.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Social Democrats' good relations with Russia date back to the Cold War era and were maintained under former Chancellor Gerhard Schroeder, a member of the board of directors of Nord Stream 2, who has just been nominated to the board of directors of Gazprom.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The crisis has generated tensions between the Social Democrats and their coalition partners.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After Chancellor Olaf Scholz stated that the decision on Nord Stream 2 would be technical and not political, his foreign minister, the environmentalist Annalena Baerbock, assured the Bundestag that a Russian invasion of Ukraine would affect the pipeline.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: While in Germany the Social Democrats are sinking in the polls, placing them behind the conservative Christian Democratic Union, abroad it is confidence in the country that's at stake.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Olaf Scholz remains committed to dialogue. After Monday's visit to Washington, he'll visit Kiev and Moscow early next week. In the meantime, there are questions, especially in Eastern Europe, as to whether Germany is a reliable partner in the biggest standoff between Russia and the West since the end of the Cold War.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: and the West since the end of the Cold War. Hundreds marched in the Spanish capital on Sunday to protest against Covid-19 restrictions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The participants largely fell into two different groups, people against vaccination and those asking for more freedom to face the pandemic without government measures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The march ended in front of the parliament where crowds listened to songs and speeches.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In the Netherlands, there was a similar sight in Rotterdam.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Thousands were also out protesting Covid-19 government restrictions with the Together for the Netherlands movement.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But unlike some previous gatherings in the city, Sunday's was peaceful.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Many of the protesters said that they weren't against vaccination, just that they wanted things to go back to normal.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And in Canada, protests against pandemic restrictions across the country entered their second week.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: What initially started as anger about vaccine requirements for truck drivers has now turned into larger concerns about health measures.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: Queen Elizabeth II has officially become the longest-serving British monarch. Having reigned for seven decades, the 95-year-old was kept busy earlier this week reviewing plans for her Platinum Jubilee celebrations in June.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Queen also marked the occasion announcing her sincere wish for Camilla, the wife of her heir Prince Charles, to be crowned Queen Consort when the time comes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: A statement that has generated mixed reactions from the public.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We maybe need a bit of a change now.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: We need to start to move on with the royal family.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: I think a change is maybe, hopefully a good thing for us.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: The Queen is going to step down at some point.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: And probably this year is maybe a good time to do it, a suitable time.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: I'm delighted. I think it's high time that she made that decision. I'm delighted that she did. And we have to move on with the times. It's way past worrying about the past. We've got to go with what's right. And if anybody else, if anybody should know what the right thing to do is, she is.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: While the monarch renewed her lifelong pledge to continue her service, she urged the British people to give her son and Camilla the same support they have given her.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: The Duchess of Cornwall, now 74, was long vilified for her role in the breakup of Charles' marriage to the late Princess Diana.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Senegal fans celebrate at home in Dakar after their team defeated Egypt 4-2 on penalties

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: at the Africa Cup of Nations final in Cameroon.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: It's the first time they've ever taken the title.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After extra time ended, still with no score, it went to the drum of penalties.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Hero Sadio Mane made up for a first-half penalty miss by converting the winning spot kick in the shootout.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The match had been billed as a battle between Liverpool stars Mane of Senegal and Mohamed Salah of Egypt, but it never reached those heights with both sides missing chances.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: While Senegal celebrate and Mane is voted the tournament's best player, an exhausted Egypt will return home after missing out on their bid to win a record-extending eighth African title.
